Class Puzzle

java.lang.Object
Puzzle
public class Puzzle extends Object
This class represents a puzzle simulator with tiles, including initial and final boards, movable tiles, holes, and glue. It allows operations such as adding, removing, moving tiles, and applying or removing glue.

    Constructor to initialize the boards without initial and final matrices.

    • lightBrown

      public static Color lightBrown

  • Constructor Details

    • Puzzle

      public Puzzle(int h, int w)
      Constructor to initialize the boards without initial and final matrices.
      Parameters:
      h - Height of the board.
      w - Width of the board.

    • Puzzle

      public Puzzle(char[][] starting, char[][] ending)
      Constructor to initialize the boards with initial and final character matrices.
      Parameters:
      starting - Initial state of the board.
      ending - Final state of the board.

    • Puzzle

      public Puzzle(char[][] ending)
      Constructor to initialize an empty initial board and a final board with tiles.
      Parameters:
      ending - Final state of the board.

    • getHeight

      Gets the height of the board.
      Returns:
      Height of the board.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Gets the width of the board.
      Returns:
      Width of the board.

    • addTile

      public void addTile(int row, int column, char label)
      Adds a tile to the board at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      row - Row index of the tile.
      column - Column index of the tile.
      label - Label of the tile.

    • deleteTile

      public void deleteTile(int row, int column)
      Removes a tile from the board at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      row - Row index of the tile.
      column - Column index of the tile.

    • relocateTile

      public void relocateTile(int[] from, int[] to)
      Relocates a tile from the given source position to the destination position.
      Parameters:
      from - the coordinates of the source position as an integer array [row, col].
      to - the coordinates of the destination position as an integer array [row, col].

    • addGlue

      public void addGlue(int row, int column)
      Applies glue to a tile at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the tile.
      column - the column of the tile.

    • deleteGlue

      public void deleteGlue(int row, int column)
      Removes glue from a tile at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the tile.
      column - the column of the tile.

    • tilt

      public void tilt(char direction)
      Tilts the board in the specified direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction to tilt ('d' for down, 'u' for up, 'r' for right, 'l' for left).

    • tiltOnce

      public boolean tiltOnce(char direction)
      Performs a single tilt in the specified direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction to tilt ('d' for down, 'u' for up, 'r' for right, 'l' for left).
      Returns:
      true if there were changes; false otherwise.

    • getTileAtPosition

      public Tile getTileAtPosition(int row, int column)
      Retrieves the tile at a specific position.
      Parameters:
      row - Row index
      column - Column index
      Returns:
      The tile at the specified position, or null if out of bounds

    • isGoal

      public boolean isGoal()
      Checks if the puzzle has reached the goal state. Compares the current board (tiles) with the reference board (ending).
      Returns:
      True if the puzzle is in the goal state, false otherwise

    • makeVisible

      public void makeVisible()
      Makes the simulator visible.

    • makeInvisible

      public void makeInvisible()
      Makes the simulator invisible.

    • finish

      public void finish()
      Ends the simulator and exits the program.

    • actualArrangement

      public char[][] actualArrangement()
      Returns a copy of the current puzzle board (starting), representing the current state.
      Returns:
      A copy of the starting matrix

    • ok

      public boolean ok()
      Returns whether the last action was successful.
      Returns:
      True if the last action was successful, false otherwise

    • exchange

      public void exchange()
      Exchanges the current puzzle board with the reference board. Swaps the starting and ending matrices and updates the tiles visually.

    • makeHole

      public void makeHole(int row, int column)
      Creates a hole in a specified tile position.
      Parameters:
      row - Row index
      column - Column index

    • fixedTiles

      public int[][] fixedTiles()
      Identifies and returns a matrix indicating the fixed tiles that cannot move.
      Returns:
      A matrix of fixed tiles, where 0 indicates a fixed tile and 1 indicates a movable tile.

    • misplacedTiles

      public int misplacedTiles()
      Counts the number of misplaced tiles compared to the reference board.
      Returns:
      The number of misplaced tiles

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
